Keywords: Armor , Robot , Sentinel
Real Name: N/A
Special Powers
RESPONDING TO THE MUTANT THREAT: SIDELINE ACTIVE - Once during your opponent's turn, for all characters with this trait, if they hit with three attacks -or- two attacks made by characters with the X-Men keyword, after resolutions you may generate a XMRF #008 Sentinel from your Sideline on click #1 in your starting area.
RETURN FOR REPAIRS: When Sentinel is KO'd, instead of putting it in your KO area, turn them to their starting line and add them to your Sideline. (They are still scored.)
Figure Errata
OLD: SIDELINE ACTIVE - Once during your opponent's turn, if they hit with three attacks -or- two attacks made by characters with the X-Men keyword, after resolutions you may place a XMRF #008 Sentinel from your Sideline on click #1 in your starting area.

Sentinels are big team heavy threat in the comics,what's with all these 2-3 click long dials? And 2 damage? Colossus laughs at pathetic Sentinel
August 27, 2021
Mutant Headcrab
The only good thing this figure has going for it is that you can potentially bring it to the field for free. Incapacitate is one of the worst attack powers in the game at the moment. Leave it on your sideline and run the Dark Phoenix Saga Sentinels on their 25 point line. You'll find more offensive utility in those even with a random start line.
August 15, 2021
tyroclix
Win/Loss: 2-1 With Incap and 2 damage, I didn't expect much from the Sentinel. As a 0 point option, he performed better than expected. Coming in usually around turns 3 to 5 meant some pieces were injured and so its 11 attack was good for picking off those pieces close to death. In sealed, it was invaluable as a taxi and best of all, a reoccurring mastermind recipient. In constructed, it may still proves worthwhile especially if/when I Incap gets its much needed update.
August 11, 2021
Goop
I dont see any reason not to have at least one of these on your sideline. Its a free fig if your opponent is rolling hot and it costs you nothing.
May 31, 2021
Organous
So many things. 1: With the bigger figure size and this being giant, I hope it ends up roughly the size of Minotaur/Ferdinand. 2: I am more inclined to be ok with this than I am with Super Friends, just because of the accessibility. If you're going to make the slots on the sideboard matter without paying points, then at least make it so that everyone can do something with it. We had allies so far, and now we get a figure that can just come out for free if you're getting rocked. 3: This is actually not bad for a cheap Incapacitate piece. 25 is a fine spot for point-filling. It will see over all the normal size characters and double-target at the standard 6 range. Extremely nice is its ability to come back after being wrecked. The use of the pronoun "they" here instead of "it" (since it's not sentient) even tells me that this is possibly a template for other characters, which seems very interesting. Filling out the sideline with cheap backup, when easily accessible and abundant, seems like an interesting game design.
